subject: Re: File from tonight
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
Robin,

If i may add my thoughts on this:  There is no concrete evidence of 
who or what comes through is what they say they are.  Technicians i 
have found were used to get you up and running and i only now call on 
them if i need assistance.  I don't turn the boxes on and ask for 
them like a crutch, i conduct my session and if i need help they will 
supply it to me if needed.  I think the whole idea is to find out who 
we are communicating with, maybe we will never really know for sure 
but i still try and find out as best as i can. 

-Steve H.

 

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Robin Searcy Henson" 
<MudPuddleFarm@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Frank, 
> 
> When you mention being distrustful of what comes through the boxes, 
are you saying you're skeptical of the "technicians" being who they 
say they are?  Not trying to open another can of worms here, just 
wanting to continue learning from your experience and research.  I 
get what you're saying about becoming obsessive with the sessions.  
I've probably asked you this a half dozen times over the last couple 
of years, but who or what do YOU think you're/we're  communicating 
with?
> 
> Robin
> 
> 
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: purplespacefriend<mailto:purplealiengirl@...> 
>   To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
>   Sent: Saturday, February 02, 2008 7:46 PM
>   Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight
> 
> 
>   Have ya tried EVPmaker? It is based on that random principle, and 
>   predates the boxes.
> 
>   I've heard this stuff before, about random being the best, and I 
>   have to disaggree. I also think it unwise to spend every waking 
>   moment doing sessions. I think it creates that expectation, and 
>   perhaps desperation to make contact, and I would tend not to 
trust 
>   what comes through. 
> 
>   I don't trust some of this stuff because I have yet get any 
>   meaningful assistence with the boxes from the so called 
technicians. 
>   All I ever got was a telepathic "suggestion" to use the echo 
boxes. 
>   Everything else was a assemblage of stuff I had worked on in hte 
past 
>   to solve the problem of "what else could I use". 
> 
>   I hate to see yet another go down the road of "this is the 
onlyest 
>   way". 
> 
>   Frank-S
>
